logic

Class Drunken

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
      • logic.Guard
        • logic.Drunken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Drunken
extends Guard
    A type of Guard that can randomly fall asleep and invert the pre-determined path's direction when he wakes up
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean invertedDirection
      If set to true, then the Drunken guard is moving in the opposite direction to the default one

    • Field Detail

      • invertedDirection

        protected boolean invertedDirection
        If set to true, then the Drunken guard is moving in the opposite direction to the default one

    • Constructor Detail

      • Drunken

        public Drunken(int startX,
               int startY)
        Constructor. Initializes all fields and puts Drunken guard at it's starting position
        Parameters:
        startX - Drunken guard's initial x-axis position
        startY - Drunken guard's initial y-axis position

    • Method Detail

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition()
        Updates the Drunken guard's position based on his movement behavior. - First, it generates a random number and depending on its value he can go (or stay) sleeping - If he's not sleeping and just woke up, another number is generated to see if he will invert his movement's direction - If neither of the previous apply, he just moves according to his last known pattern
        Specified by:
        updatePosition in class Guard

      • isSleep

        public boolean isSleep()
        Checks if Drunken guard is currently sleeping
        Returns:
        true if he indeed isn't moving, false otherwise
